body: `String`s like these would be better off in the `strings.xml` resource file. Then when you want to make some changes it is all handy in one place...

Nice and descriptive, but consider this to make it even better:
 
Keeping with the best naming conventions of using only lowercase letters and underscore, starting with the view we have to ID and ending where we want the view to go, we get the following:
 
`/imageview_playlist` or something close to that...
 
That way your code becomes almost completely self-documenting because it will be obvious in Java files and here not just what the view is but also what its function is.
 
See also resource referenced in Project Review.

Note that all your xml layout files (with the exception of `activity_main`) are called `intent` but they would be better described as `activity_playlist`... because they are what we refer to as an activity in Android. `Intent` is part of the code you are using correctly...
